verbs.description: subdivide (third-person singular simple present subdivides, present participle subdividing, simple past and past participle subdivided)

definitionGroups.group: (transitive, intransitive) To divide into smaller sections.

entries.meaning: (real estate) To divide a plot of land into plots for residences; to convert open land into housing.
examples: This used to be farmland before developers bought it and subdivided it.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To divide divisions into smaller divisions.
examples: The progenies of Cham and Japhet swarmed into colonies, and those colonies were subdivided into many others.
